HOLDS.Definition: is going to be or has in store

EERILY.Definition: in a strange and frightening way

DESPITE.Definition: without being affected by, even with

PRE-DEFINED.Definition: given form in advance or beforehand

ADAPT.Definition: change so that he suits a new purpose, become adjusted to new conditions

PACE.Definition: the speed at which something is developing

PREDECESSORS.Definition: the generations that came before ours

ESSAY.Definition: a short piece of writing on a usually serious subject

OUTSIDER.Definition: someone who wasn't invovled in similar matters

FAMINE.Definition: a situation of extreme hunger, starvation

INHERENT.Definition: existing as a natural and permanent characteristic

FOLLOWED IN HIS FOOTSTEPS.Definition: did the same thing that he had done

AUTOMATION.Definition: the use of machines and computers

MECHANISATION.Definition: the process of having tasks and work done by machines

BLURRING.Definition: making them unclear or harder to see

LEISURE.Definition: the time when you are not working, free time

FULFILLING.Definition: making you feel satisfaction and happiness

WACKY.Definition: funny or amusing in a strange way

AHEAD OF THE CURVE.Definition: faster about doing it, more advanced

ARMAGEDDON.Definition: the end of the world as described in the Bible

CARRIAGE.Definition: a vehicle with four wheels used in the past and usually pulled by horses

SELF-DRIVING.Definition: having the ability to drive itself

FASHION SENSE.Definition: sense of style, idea of what is fashionable

HINDSIGHT.Definition: ability to understand something after it has happened

WARFARE.Definition: the activity of fighting a war

TUMOUR.Definition: the groups of abnormal cells often caused by cancer

NOT-SO-DISTANT.Definition: time not so far in the (future)

RUNNER UP.Definition: someone that comes second in a competition

URBAN LEGEND.Definition: information that is believed to be true by some people

GLOOMIEST.Definition: causing extreme depression, without hope whatsoever
